p: The overall recurrence rate (local and distant) was 17.6% in the LAR group compared to 23.9% for APER, p = 0.257. There was no difference either in the local recurrence or in the distant recurrence rate between the 2 groups (p = 1.000 and 0.215 respectively). There was also no significant difference in disease-free survival between the two groups (p = 0.455, Fig. 3). R1 resection was found to have a negative impact on survival and recurrence disease (Figs. 4 and 5). Furthermore, T stage and N stage was found to have a negative impact on patient survival (Figs. 6 and 7).
